text:
Water Management (Watercourse Authority Exemption) Order 2009

I make the following order under section 123G(1) of the Water Management Act 1999 .

20 January 2009

D. E. LLEWELLYN

Minister for Primary Industries and Water

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Water Management (Watercourse Authority Exemption) Order 2009 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which the provisions of the Water Legislation Amendment Act 2008 commence.

3. Interpretation
    The Acts Interpretation Act 1931 applies to the interpretation of this order as if it were regulations within the meaning of that Act.

4. Exemption
    It is declared that Part 6A of the Water Management Act 1999 does not apply to the following water entities:
            (a) the following bodies corporate under the Corporations Act:
                    (i) Cressy Longford Irrigation Scheme Ltd. (ACN 097 994 100);
                    (ii) . . . . . . . .
            (b) the Corporation within the meaning of the Water and Sewerage Corporation Act 2012 ;
            (c) . . . . . . . .
            (d) the Director of Inland Fisheries;
            (e) the following Government Business Enterprises:
                    (i) Hydro-Electric Corporation;
                    (ii) . . . . . . . .
            (ea) the River Clyde Trust, a trust reconstituted under section 308 of the Water Management Act 1999 ;
            (f) the Elizabeth Macquarie Irrigation Trust, a trust established under Part 10 of the Water Management Act 1999 .

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 11 February 2009

This order is administered in the Department of Primary Industries and Water.
